titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mary Agnes Brady Papers MC.186
titlestmt.author: Jonathan Lawler.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-12 19:09:59 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: in 1 manuscript box and one oversize box

did.abstract: This collection comprises the personal papers of Mary Agnes Brady, graduate student in the School of Education, Health, Nursing, and the Arts Professions (now the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education and Human Development). This collections contains class notes, papers, and assignments relating to theater history, theory, and performance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains papers, play scripts, stage set designs, costume designs, scrapbooks and course notes by Mary Agnes Brady, a 1939 graduate of the School of Education. Brady's class notes consist of the history, theory, and practice of theater. The two scrapbooks in the collection contain images of costumes and set layouts designed by Brady as well as a script of Romeo and Juliet edited by her.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Collection Name; MC 186; box number; folder number; New York University Archives

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material is arranged by record type in a single series.

bioghist.head: Biography of Mary Agnes Brady
bioghist.p: Mary Agnes Brady was a masters student in the School of Education, Health, Nursing, and the Arts Professions concentrating in theater. She earned a Master of Arts degree in 1939. Prior to attending New York University, Brady received a Bachelor of Arts degree from Miami University in 1934.

processinfo.head: Preservation Action
processinfo.p: Collection contains fragile paper documents. Preservation action, consisting of interleaving with archival paper, was taken on two colored drawings located in "Play Production."
